author: pipermerriam
content: <@!893550372885504070> they all look like they are still relevant but don't take my word as truth.  For example, portal client implementation in geth *might* be a good project, but it also might be a dead end without buy in from the geth team, but it also might not be feasible to get buy-in from the geth team without a demonstrable working implementation that improves the client in some way...

author: pipermerriam
content:
If you (or anyone here really) wants to play the long game, meaning, choosing a topic that is big and deep but should remain relevant for the next few years since they are going to take a lot of time and effort to deliver, I'd recommend these topics:

- verkle/state-expiry/address-space-extension
- post-merge-data-shards + L2-optimistic-rollups + how-to-get-users-activity-on-L2-ASAP + tooling-needed-for-L2-adoption
- account-abstraction + tooling-needed-for-account-abstraction-adoption + maybe-transaction-batching-and-other-loosely-related-concepts

There's still lots of really relevant things that aren't part of this list.  Choosing one of these is choosing to "Eat an Elephant" (https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/eat_an_elephant_one_bite_at_a_time)
